summary.long: Matthew is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ the son of David, the son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham begat Isaac. And Isaac begat Jacob. And Jacob begat Judah and his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah begat Perez, and Zerah of Tamar. And Perez begat Hezron. And Hezron begat Ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ram begat Amminadab. And Amminadab begat Nahshon. And Nahshon begat Salmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Salmon begat Boaz of Rahab. And Boaz begat Obed of Ruth. And Obed begat Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesse begat David the King. And David the King begat Solomon of her that was the wife of Uriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Solomon begat Rehoboam. And Rehoboam begat Abijah. And Abijah begat Asa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Asa begat Jehoshaphat. And Jehoshaphat begat Joram. And Joram begat Uzziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Uzziah begat Jotham. And Jotham begat Ahaz. And Ahaz begat Hezekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hezekiah begat Manasseh. And Manasseh begat Amon. And Amon begat Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Josiah begat Jakim. And Jakim begat Jeconiah and his brethren about the time they were carried away to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they were carried away into Babylon, Jeconiah begat Shealtiel. And Shealtiel be-gat Zerubbabel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zerubbabel begat Abiud. And Abiud begat Eliakim. And Eliakim begat Azor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Azor begat Zadok. And Zadok begat Achim. And Achim begat Eliud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eliud begat Eleazar. And Eleazar begat Matthan. And Matthan begat Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, that is called Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the generations from Abraham to David, are fourteen generations. And from David until they were carried away into Babylon, fourteen generations: and after they were carried away into Babylon until Christ, fourteen generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was thus, When as his mother Mary was betrothed to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph her husband being a just man, and not willing to make her a public example, was minded to put her away secretly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while he thought these things, behold, the Angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, the son of David, fear not to take Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her, is of the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name JESUS: for he shall save his people from their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all this was done that it might be fulfilled, which is spoken of the Lord by the Prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a virgin shall be with child, and shall bear a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which is by interpretation, God with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph being raised from sleep, did as the Angel of the Lord had enjoined him, and took his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew her not, till she had brought forth her first born son, and he called his name JESUS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus then was born at Bethlehem in Judea, in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came Wise men from the East to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Where is the King of the Jews that is born? for we have seen his star in the East, and are come to worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When king Herod heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And gathering together all the chief Priests and Scribes of the people, he asked of them, where Christ should be born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, At Bethlehem in Judea: for so it is written by the Prophet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou Bethlehem in the land of Judah, art not the least among the Princes of Judah: for out of thee shall come the governor that shall feed my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod privily called the Wise men, and diligently inquired of them the time of the star that appeared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sent them to Bethlehem, saying, Go, and search diligently for the babe: and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come also, and worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had heard the king, they departed: and lo, the star which they had seen in the East, went before them, till it came and stood over the place where the babe was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw the star, they rejoiced with an exceeding great joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And went into the house, and found the babe with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him, and opened their treasures, and presented unto him gifts, even gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they were warned of God in a dream, that they should not go again to Herod, they returned into their country another way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After their departure, behold, the Angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the babe and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be there till I bring thee word, for Herod will seek the babe to destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he arose and took the babe and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And was there unto the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled, which is spoken of the Lord by the Prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod, seeing that he was mocked of the Wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the male children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently searched out of the Wise men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was that fulfilled which is spoken by the Prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Ramah was a voice heard, mourning, and weeping, and great howling: Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they were not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Herod was dead, behold, an Angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Arise, and take the babe and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the babe’s life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he arose up, and took the babe and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judea instead of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: yet after he was warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And went and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Prophets, which was, That he should be called a Nazarite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in those days, John the Baptist came and preached in the wilderness of Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is he of whom it is spoken by the Prophet Isaiah, saying, The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord: make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this John had his garment of camel’s hair, and a girdle of a skin about his loins, his meat was also locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then went out to him Jerusalem and all Judea, and all the region round about Jordan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he saw many of the Pharisees, and of the Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath forewarned you to flee from the anger to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring forth therefore fruit worthy amendment of life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And think not to say with yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able even of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now also is the axe put to the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit, is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed I baptize you with water to amendment of life, but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear, he will baptize you with the holy Ghost, and with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which hath his fan in his hand, and will make clean his floor, and gather his wheat into his garner, but will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John to be baptized of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But John earnestly put him back, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answering, said to him, Let be now: for thus it becometh us to fulfill all righteousness. So he suffered him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus when he was baptized, came straight out of the water. And lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and John saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and [lighting] upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, a voice came from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was Jesus led aside of the Spirit into the wilderness, to be tempted of the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had fasted forty days, and forty nights, he was afterward hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came to him the tempter, and said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answering, said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread only, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took him up into the holy city, and set him on a pinnacle of the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down, for it is written, that he will give his Angels charge over thee, and with their hands they shall lift thee up, lest at any time thou shouldest dash thy foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again the devil took him up into an exceeding high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said to him, All these will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down, and worship me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto him, Avoid Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil left him: and behold, the Angels came, and ministered unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus had heard that John was committed to prison, he returned into Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving Nazareth, went and dwelt in Capernaum, which is near the sea in the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the Prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of Zebulun, and the land of Naphtali by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people which sat in darkness, saw great light: and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death, light is risen up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Amend your lives: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus walking by the sea of Galilee saw two brethren, Simon, which was called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea (for they were fishers.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they straightway leaving the nets, followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was gone forth from thence, he saw other two brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and he called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they without tarrying, leaving the ship and their father, followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their Synagogues, and preaching the Gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness, and every disease among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his fame spread abroad through all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people, that were taken with divers diseases, and torments, and them that were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatic, and those that had the palsy: and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there followed him great multitudes out of Galilee, and Decapolis, and Jerusalem, and Judea, and from beyond Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw the multitude, he went up into a mountain: and when he was set, his disciples came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are they which hunger and thirst for righteousness: for they shall be filled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are they which suffer persecution for righteousness’ sake; for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed shall ye be when men revile you, and persecute you, and say all manner of evil against you for my sake, falsely.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rejoice and be glad, for great is your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the Prophets which were before you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savor, wherewith shall it be salted? It is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill, cannot be hid.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick, and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your father which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Think not that I am come to destroy the Law, or the Prophets. I am not come to destroy them, but to fulfill them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For truly I say unto you, Till heaven and earth perish, one jot or one tittle of the Law shall not escape, till all things be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall observe and teach them, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I say unto you, except your righteousness exceed the righteousness of the Scribes and Pharisees, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye have heard that it was said unto them of the old time, Thou shalt not kill: for whosoever killeth shall be culpable of judgment.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, whosoever is angry with his brother unadvisedly, shall be culpable of judgment. And whosoever saith unto his brother, Raca, shall be worthy to be punished by the Council. And whosoever shall say, Fool, shall be worthy to be punished with hell fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If then thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Leave there thine offering before the altar, and go thy way: first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Agree with thine adversary quickly, while thou art in the way with him, lest thine adversary deliver thee to the Judge, and the Judge deliver thee to the sergeant, and thou be cast into prison.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Verily I say unto thee, thou shalt not come out thence, till thou hast paid the utmost farthing.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye have heard that it was said to them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, that whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her, hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Wherefore if thy right eye cause thee to offend, pluck it out and cast it from thee: for better it is for thee, that one of thy members perish, than that thy whole body should be cast into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Also if thy right hand make thee to offend, cut it off, and cast it from thee: for better it is for thee, that one of thy members perish, than that thy whole body should be cast into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It hath been said also, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a bill of divorcement.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, whosoever shall put away his wife (except it be for fornication) causeth her to commit adultery: and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced, committeth adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again, ye have heard that it was said to them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform thine oaths to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, Swear not at all, neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nor yet by the earth, for it is his footstool: neither by Jerusalem: for it is the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Neither shalt thou swear by thine head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But let your communication be Yea, yea: Nay, nay. For whatsoever is more than these, cometh of evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye have heard that it hath been said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, Resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloak also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whosoever will compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give to him that asketh, and from him that would borrow of thee, turn not away.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbor, and hate thine enemy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, Love your enemies: bless them that curse you: do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which hurt you, and persecute you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: That ye may be the children of your father that is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to arise on the evil and the good, and sendeth rain on the just and unjust.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if ye love them, which love you, what reward shall you have? Do not the Publicans even the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if ye be friendly to your brethren only, what singular thing do ye? do not even the Publicans likewise?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye shall therefore be perfect, as your Father which is in heaven, is perfect.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Take heed that ye give not your alms before men to be seen of them, or else ye shall have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore when thou givest thine alms, thou shalt not make a trumpet to be blown before thee, as the hypocrites do in the Synagogues and in the streets, to be praised of men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when thou doest thine alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: That thine alms may be in secret, and thy Father that seeth in secret, he will reward thee openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when thou prayest, be not as the hypocrites: for they love to stand and pray in the Synagogues, and in the corners of the streets, because they would be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when thou prayest, enter into thy chamber: and when thou hast shut thy door, pray unto thy Father which is in secret, and thy Father which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Also when ye pray, use no vain repetitions as the Heathen: for they think to be heard for their much babbling.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Be ye not like them therefore: for your Father knoweth whereof ye have need, before ye ask of him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After this manner therefore pray ye, Our father which art in heaven, hallowed be thy name.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done even in earth as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give us this day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: for thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory for ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if ye do forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if ye do not forgive men their trespasses, no more will your father forgive you your trespasses.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Moreover, when ye fast, look not sour as the hypocrites: for they disfigure their faces, that they might seem unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you that they have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: That thou seem not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret, will reward thee openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Lay not up treasures for yourselves upon the earth, where the moth and canker corrupt, and where thieves dig through and steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But lay up treasures for yourselves in heaven, where neither the moth nor canker corrupteth, and where thieves neither dig through nor steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The light of the body is the eye: if then thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be light.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if thine eye be wicked, then all thy body shall be dark. Wherefore if the light that is in thee, be darkness, how great is that darkness?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No man can serve two masters: for either he shall hate the one, and love the other, or else he shall lean to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and riches.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore I say unto you, be not careful for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink: nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more worth than meat? and the body than raiment?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Behold the fowls of the heaven: for they sow not, neither reap, nor carry into the barns, yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which of you by taking care is able to add one cubit unto his stature?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And why care ye for raiment? Learn how the Lilies of the field do grow: they are not wearied, neither spin:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yet I say unto you, that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Wherefore if God so clothe the grass of the field which is today, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, shall he not do much more unto you, O ye of little faith?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or what shall we drink? or wherewith shall we be clothed?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: (For after all these things seek the Gentiles) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness, and all these things shall be ministered unto you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Care not then for the morrow, for the morrow shall care for itself: the day hath enough with his own grief.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Judge not, that ye be not judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged, and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured unto you again.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And why seest thou the mote, that is in thy brother’s eye, and perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or how sayest thou to thy brother, Suffer me to cast out the mote out of thine eye, and behold, a beam is in thine own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Hypocrite, first cast out that beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give ye not that which is holy to dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they tread them under their feet, and turning again, all to rent you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ask, and it shall be given you: seek, and ye shall find: knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For whosoever asketh, receiveth: and he that seeketh, findeth: and to him that knocketh, it shall be opened.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For what man is there among you, which if his son ask him bread, would give him a stone?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or if he ask fish, will he give him a serpent?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If ye then, which are evil, can give to your children good gifts, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven, give good things to them that ask him?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore whatsoever ye would that men should do to you: even so do ye to them: for this is the Law and the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Enter in at the strait gate: for it is the wide gate, and broad way that leadeth to destruction: and many there be which go in thereat.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Because the gate is strait, and the way narrow that leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns? or figs of thistles?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So every good tree bringeth forth good fruit, and a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit, is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore by their fruits ye shall know them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Not everyone that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven, but he that doeth my Father’s will which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not by thy Name prophesied, and by thy name cast out devils? and by thy name done many great works?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And then will I profess to them, I never knew you, depart from me ye that work iniquity.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whosoever then heareth of me these words, and doeth the same, I will liken him to a wise man, which hath builded his house on a rock:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house, and it fell not: for it was grounded on a rock,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whosoever heareth these my words, and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, which hath builded his house upon the sand:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house, and it fell, and the fall thereof was great.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these words, the people were astonished at his doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he taught them as one having authority, and not as the Scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, there came a Leper and worshipped him, saying, Master, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus putting forth his hand, touched him, saying, I will, be thou clean: and immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, See thou tell no man, but go, and show thyself unto the Priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a witness to them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a Centurion, beseeching him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, Master, my servant lieth sick at home of the palsy, and is grievously pained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, I will come and heal him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the Centurion answered, saying, Master, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am a man also under the authority of another, and have soldiers under me: and I say to one, Go, and he goeth: and to another, Come, and he cometh: and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard that, he marveled, and said to them that followed him, Verily, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, even in Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say unto you, that many shall come from the East and West, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into utter darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto the Centurion, Go thy way, and as thou hast believed, so be it unto thee. And his servant was healed the same hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when Jesus came to Peter’s house, he saw his wife’s mother laid down, and sick of a fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her: so she arose, and ministered unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Even was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits with his word, and healed all that were sick,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That it might be fulfilled, which was spoken by Isaiah the Prophet, saying, He took our infirmities, and bare our sicknesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus saw great multitudes of people about him, he commanded them to go over the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came there a certain Scribe, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the heaven have nests, but the Son of man hath not whereon to rest his head.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And another of his disciples said unto him, Master, suffer me first to go, and bury my father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said unto him, Follow me, and let the dead bury the dead.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when he was entered into the ship, his disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, so that the ship was covered with waves: but he was asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples came, and awoke him, saying, Master, save us: we perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea: and so there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the men marveled, saying, What man is this, that both the winds and the sea obey him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met him two possessed with devils which came out of the graves very fierce, so that no man might go by that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, they cried out, saying, Jesus the son of God, what have we to do with thee? Art thou come hither to torment us before the time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was afar off from them, a great herd of swine feeding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go into the herd of swine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Go. So they went out and departed into the herd of swine: and behold, the whole herd of swine ran headlong into the sea, and died in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the herdmen fled: and when they were come into the city, they told all things, and what was become of them that were possessed with the devils,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus: and when they saw him, they besought him to depart out of their coasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy laid on a bed. And Jesus seeing their faith, said to the sick of the palsy, Son be of good comfort: thy sins are forgiven thee.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And behold, certain of the Scribes said with themselves, This man blasphemeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus saw their thoughts, he said, Wherefore think ye evil things in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For whether is it easier to say, Thy sins are forgiven thee, or to say, Arise, and walk?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And that ye may know that the Son of man hath authority in earth to forgive sins (then said he unto the sick of the palsy,) Arise, take up thy bed, and go to thine house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he arose, and departed to his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the multitude saw it, they marveled, and glorified God, which had given such authority to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man sitting at the custom, named Matthew, and said to him, Follow me. And he arose, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, behold, many Publicans and sinners that came thither, sat down at the table with Jesus and his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisees saw that, they said to his disciples, Why eateth your Master with Publicans and sinners?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard it, he said unto them, The whole need not the Physician, but they that are sick.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But go ye and learn what this is, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but the sinners to repentance.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then came the disciples of John to him, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, and thy disciples fast not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the marriage chamber mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Moreover, no man pieceth an old garment with a piece of new cloth: for that that should fill it up, taketh away from the garment, and the breach is worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither do they put new wine into old vessels: for then the vessels would break, and the wine would be spilt, and the vessels would perish: but they put new wine into new vessels, and so are both preserved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: While he thus spake unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is now deceased: but come and lay thine hand on her, and she shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus arose and followed him with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And behold, a woman which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behind him, and touched the hem of his garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she said in herself, If I may touch but his garment only, I shall be whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus turned him about, and seeing her, did say, Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole. And the woman was made whole at that same moment.)
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the minstrels and the multitude making noise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto them, Get you hence: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth. And they laughed him to scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the multitude were put forth, he went in and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this bruit went throughout all that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying, O son of David, have mercy upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come into the house, the blind came to him, and Jesus said unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? And they said unto him, Yea, Lord.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And their eyes were opened, and Jesus gave them great charge, saying, See that no man know it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they were departed, they spread abroad his fame throughout all that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: then the multitude marveled, saying, The like was never seen in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils, through the prince of devils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went about all cities and towns, teaching in their Synagogues, and preaching the Gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw the multitude, he had compassion upon them, because they were dispersed, and scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to his disciples, Surely the harvest is great, but the laborers are few.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Wherefore pray the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth laborers into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he called his twelve disciples unto him, and gave them power against unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every sickness, and every disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the names of the twelve Apostles are these. The first is Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip and Bartholomew: Thomas, and Matthew that Publican: James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus whose surname was Thaddaeus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twelve did Jesus send forth, and commanded them, saying, Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into the cities of the Samaritans enter ye not:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as ye go preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Heal the sick: cleanse the lepers: raise up the dead: cast out the devils. Freely ye have received, freely give.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Possess not gold, nor silver, nor money in your girdles,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nor a scrip for the journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor a staff: for the workman is worthy of his meat.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall come, inquire who is worthy in it, and there abide till ye go thence.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when ye come into an house, salute the same.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house, or that city, shake off the dust of your feet.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Truly I say unto you, it shall be easier for them of the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment, than for that city.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Behold, I send you as sheep in the midst of the wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and innocent as doves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But beware of men, for they will deliver you up to the Councils, and will scourge you in their Synagogues.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And ye shall be brought to the governors and kings for my sake, in witness to them, and to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that hour, what ye shall say.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For it is not ye that speak, but the spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son, and the children shall rise against their parents, and shall cause them to die.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my Name: but he that endureth to the end, he shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when they persecute you in this city, flee into another: for verily I say unto you, ye shall not go over all the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The disciple is not above his master, nor the servant above his Lord.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is enough for the disciple to be as his master is, and the servant as his Lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more them of his household?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be disclosed, nor hid, that shall not be known.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What I tell you in darkness, that speak ye in light: and what ye hear in the ear, that preach ye on the houses.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And fear ye not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him, which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing, and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yea, and all the hairs of your head are numbered.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Fear ye not therefore, ye are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Think not that I am come to send peace into the earth, but the sword.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And a man’s enemies shall be they of his own household.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that loveth father or mother more than me, is not worthy of me. And he that loveth son, or daughter more than me, is not worthy of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he that taketh not his cross, and followeth after me, is not worthy of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that will find his life, shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake, shall find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that receiveth you, receiveth me: and he that receiveth me, receiveth him that sent me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that receiveth a Prophet in the name of a Prophet, shall receive a Prophet’s reward: and he that receiveth a righteous man, in the name of a righteous man, shall receive the reward of a righteous man.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whosoever shall give unto one of these little ones to drink a cup of cold water only, in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when John heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples, and said unto him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art thou he that should come, or shall we look for another?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answering, said unto them, Go, and show John, what things ye hear and see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blind receive sight, and the halt do walk: the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor receive the Gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is he that shall not be offended in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they departed, Jesus began to speak unto the multitude of John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? a reed shaken with the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what went ye out to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold they that wear soft clothing, are in kings’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what went ye out to see? A Prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and more than a Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is he of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face which shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Among them which are begotten of women, arose there not a greater than John Baptist, notwithstanding, he that is the least in the kingdom of heaven, is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the time of John Baptist hitherto, the kingdom of God suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the Prophets and the Law prophesied unto John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye will receive it, this is that Elijah, which was to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath ears to hear let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto little children which sit in the markets, and call unto their fellows,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced, we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of men came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a glutton and a drinker of wine, a friend unto Publicans and sinners: but wisdom is justified of her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then began he to upbraid the cities, wherein most of his great works were done, because they repented not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to thee Chorazin: Woe be to thee Bethsaida: for if the great works which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they had repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you, It shall be easier for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou Capernaum, which art lifted up unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the great works, which have been done in thee, had been done among them of Sodom, they had remained to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, that it shall be easier for them of the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus answered and said, I give thee thanks, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise, and men of understanding, and hast opened them unto babes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is so, O Father, because thy good pleasure was such.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things are given unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father: neither knoweth any man the Father, but the Son, and he to whom the Son will reveal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come unto me, all ye that are weary and laden, and I will ease you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take my yoke on you, and learn of me that I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus went on a Sabbath day through the corn, and his disciples were an hungered, and began to pluck the ears of corn and to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did when he was an hungered, and they that were with him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How he went into the house of God, and did eat the showbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them which were with him, but only for the Priests?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or have ye not read in the Law, how that on the Sabbath days the Priests in the Temple break the Sabbath, and are blameless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, that here is one greater than the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore if ye knew what this is, I will have mercy and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the innocents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the son of man is Lord, even of the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he departed thence, and went into their Synagogue:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man which had his hand dried up. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal upon a Sabbath day? that they might accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, What man shall there be among you, that hath a sheep, and if it fall on the Sabbath day into a pit, doth not take it and lift it out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much more then is a man better than a sheep? therefore, it is lawful to do well on a Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it forth, and it was made whole as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went out, and consulted against him, how they might destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus knew it, he departed thence, and great multitudes followed him, and he healed them all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And charged them in threatening wise, that they should not make him known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the Prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold my servant whom I have chosen, my beloved in whom my soul delighteth: I will put my Spirit on him, and he shall show judgment to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not strive, nor cry, neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A bruised reed shall he not break, and smoking flax shall he not quench, till he bring forth judgment unto victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in his Name shall the Gentiles trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was brought to him one possessed with a devil, both blind and dumb, and he healed him, so that he which was blind and dumb, both spake and saw,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people were amazed, and said, Is not this that son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This man casteth the devils no otherwise out but through Beelzebub the prince of devils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus knew their thoughts, and said to them, Every kingdom divided against itself, is brought to naught, and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself: how shall then his kingdom endure?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also if I through Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they shall be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then is the kingdom of God come unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Else how can a man enter into a strong man’s house and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man, and then spoil his house?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is not with me, is against me: and he that gathereth not with me, scattereth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore I say unto you, Every sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men: but the blasphemy against the holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall speak a word against the son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but whosoever shall speak against the holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, nor in the world to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Either make the tree good, and his fruit good: or else make the tree evil, and his fruit evil: for the tree is known by the fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O generations of vipers, how can you speak good things, when ye are evil? For of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of an evil treasure, bringeth forth evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, that of every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof at the day of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered certain of the Scribes and of the Pharisees, saying, Master, we would see a sign of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to them, An evil and adulterous generation seeketh a sign, but no sign shall be given unto it, save that sign of the Prophet Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the whale’s belly: so shall the son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah: and behold, a greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Queen of the South shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon: and behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh throughout dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he saith, I will return into mine house from whence I came: and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept and garnished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he goeth, and taketh unto him seven other spirits worse than himself, and they enter in, and dwell there: and the end of that man is worse than the beginning. Even so shall it be with this wicked generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he yet spake to the multitude, behold, his mother, and his brethren stood without, desiring to speak with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said to him that told him, Who is my mother, and who are my brethren?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples and said, Behold my mother, and my brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever shall do my Father’s will which is in heaven, the same is my brother and sister and mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great multitudes resorted unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat down: and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he spake many things to them in parables, saying, Behold, a sower went forth to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell upon stony ground, where they had not much earth, and anon they sprung up, because they had no depth of earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the sun was up, they were parched, and for lack of rooting withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprung up, and choked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some again fell in good ground, and brought forth fruit, one corn an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, and another thirtyfold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came, and said to him, Why speakest thou to them in parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said unto them, Because it is given unto you to know the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore speak I to them in parables, because they seeing, do not see: and hearing, they hear not, neither understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah, which prophecy saith, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand, and seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this people’s heart is waxed fat, and their ears are dull of hearing, and with their eyes they have winked, lest they should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and should understand with their hearts, and should return, that I might heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But blessed are your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For verily I say unto you, that many Prophets, and righteous men have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen them, and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear ye therefore the parable of the Sower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whensoever any man heareth the word of that kingdom, and understandeth it not, that evil one cometh, and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart: and this is he which hath received the seed by the way side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that received seed in the stony ground, is he which heareth the word, and incontinently with joy receiveth it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet hath he no root in himself, and endureth but a season: for as soon as tribulation or persecution cometh because of the word, by and by he is offended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that received the seed among thorns, is he that heareth the word: but the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he is made unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that received the seed in the good ground, is he that heareth the word, and understandeth it, which also beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, and some thirtyfold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like unto a man which sowed good seed in his field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while men slept, there came his enemy and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the servants of the householder, and said unto him, Master, sowest thou not good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Some envious man hath done this. Then the servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, Nay, lest while ye go about to gather the tares, ye pluck up also with them the wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and in time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye first the tares, and bind them in sheaves to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another parable he put forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like unto a grain of mustard seed, which a man taketh and soweth in his field:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and it is a tree, so that the birds of heaven come and build in the branches thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another parable spake he to them, The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman taketh and hideth in three pecks of meal, till all be leavened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables, and without parables spake he not unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That it might be fulfilled, which was spoken by the Prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables, and will utter the things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then sent Jesus the multitude away, and went into the house. And his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of that field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered he, and said to them, He that soweth the good seed, is the son of man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the field is the world, and the good seed are the children of the kingdom, and the tares are the children of that wicked one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the enemy that soweth them, is the devil, and the harvest is the end of the world, and the reapers be the Angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As then the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so shall it be in the end of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of man shall send forth his Angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire. There shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the just men shine as the sun in the kingdom of their father. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a treasure hid in the field, which when a man hath found, he hideth it, and for joy thereof departeth, and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like to a merchant man that seeketh good pearls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who having found a pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a draw net cast into the sea, that gathereth of all kinds of things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which, when it is full, men draw to land, and sit and gather the good into vessels, and cast the bad away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall it be at the end of the world. The Angels shall go forth, and sever the bad from among the just,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Understand ye all these things? They said unto him, Yea, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he unto them, Therefore every Scribe which is taught unto the kingdom of heaven, is like unto an householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasure things both new and old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that when Jesus had ended these parables, he departed thence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And came into his own country, and taught them in their Synagogue, so that they were astonied, and said, Whence cometh this wisdom and great works unto this man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this the carpenter’s son? Is not his mother called Mary, and his brethren James and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And are not his sisters all with us? Whence then hath he all these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were offended with him. Then Jesus said to them, A Prophet is not without honor, save in his own country, and in his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not many great works there, for their unbelief’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Herod the Tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto his servants, This is that John Baptist, he is risen again from the dead, and therefore great works are wrought by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod had taken John, and bound him, and put him in prison for Herodias’ sake, his brother Philip’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod’s birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore he promised with an oath, that he would give her whatsoever she would ask.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John Baptist’s head in a platter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king was sorry: nevertheless, because of the oath, and them that sat with him at the table, he commanded it to be given her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sent, and beheaded John in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his head was brought in a platter, and given to the maid, and she brought it unto her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus heard it, he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart. And when the multitude had heard it, they followed him on foot out of the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went forth and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when even was come, his disciples came to him, saying, This is a desert place, and the time is already past: let the multitude depart, that they may go into the towns, and buy them vittles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, They have no need to go away: give ye them to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said they unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Bring them hither to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass, and took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake, and gave the loaves to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did all eat, and were sufficed, and they took up of the fragments that remained, twelve baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that had eaten, were about five thousand men, beside women and little children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway Jesus compelled his disciples to enter into a ship, and to go over before him, while he sent the multitude away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he had sent the multitude away, he went up into a mountain alone to pray: and when the evening was come, he was there alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ship was now in the midst of the sea, and was tossed with waves: for it was a contrary wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fourth watch of the night, Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a spirit, and cried out for fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good comfort, It is I: be not afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered him, and said, Master, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee on the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Come. And when Peter was come down out of the ship, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw a mighty wind, he was afraid: and as he began to sink, he cried, saying, Master, save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand, and caught him, and said to him, O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they that were in the ship, came and worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men of that place knew him, they sent out into all that country round about, and brought unto him all that were sick,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And besought him, that they might touch the hem of his garment only: and as many as touched it were made whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came to Jesus the Scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the Elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God hath commanded, saying, Honor thy father and mother: and he that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to father or mother, By the gift that is offered by me, thou mayest have profit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though he honor not his father, or his mother, shall be free: thus have ye made the commandment of God of no authority by your tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O hypocrites, Isaiah prophesied well of you, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This people draweth near unto me with their mouth, and honoreth me with the lips, but their heart is far off from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in vain they worship me, teaching for doctrines, men’s precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called the multitude unto him, and said to them, Hear and understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which goeth into the mouth, defileth not the man, but that which cometh out of the mouth that defileth the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Perceivest thou not, that the Pharisees are offended in hearing this saying?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, Every plant which mine heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them alone, they be the blind leaders of the blind: and if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Peter, and said to him, Declare unto us this parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus, Are ye yet without understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perceive ye not yet, that whatsoever entereth into the mouth, goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth, come from the heart, and they defile the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false testimonies, slanders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things which defile the man: but to eat with unwashed hands, defileth not the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman a Canaanite came out of the same coasts, and cried, saying unto him, Have mercy on me, O Lord, the son of David: my daughter is miserably vexed with a devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered her not a word. Then came to him his disciples, and besought him, saying, Send her away, for she crieth after us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said, I am not sent, but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet she came, and worshipped him, saying, Lord help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, and said, It is not good to take the children’s bread, and to cast it to whelps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she said, Truth, Lord: yet indeed the whelps eat of the crumbs, which fall from their master’s table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto her, O woman, great is thy faith: be it to thee, as thou desirest. And her daughter was made whole at that hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went away from thence, and came near unto the sea of Galilee, and went up in a mountain and sat down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great multitudes came unto him, having with them, halt, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down, at Jesus’ feet, and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
