verses.text: Insomuch that the multitude wondered, to see the dumb speak, the maimed whole, the halt to go, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus called his disciples unto him, and said, I have compassion on this multitude, because they have continued with me already three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not let them depart fasting, lest they faint in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples said unto him, Whence should we get so much bread in the wilderness, as should suffice so great a multitude!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commandeth the multitude to sit down on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And took the seven loaves, and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake them, and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did all eat, and were sufficed, and they took up of the fragments that remained, seven baskets full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that had eaten, were four thousand men, beside women, and little children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the parts of Magdala.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the Pharisees and Sadducees, and did tempt him, desiring him to show them a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said unto them, When it is evening, ye say, Fair weather, for the sky is red.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning, ye say, Today shall be a tempest: for the sky is red and lowering. O hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky, and can ye not discern the signs of the times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wicked generation, and adulterous seeketh a sign, but there shall no sign be given it, but that sign of the Prophet Jonah: so he left them, and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is because we have brought no bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus knowing it, said unto them, O ye of little faith, why reason ye thus among yourselves, because ye have brought no bread?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do ye not yet perceive, neither remember the five loaves, when there were five thousand men, and how many baskets took ye up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither the seven loaves when there were four thousand men, and how many baskets took ye up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why perceive ye not that I said not unto you concerning bread, that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then understood they that he had not said that they should beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees, and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus came into the coasts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, Whom do men say that I, the son of man, am?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, Some say, John Baptist: and some, Elijah: and others, Jeremiah, or one of the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto them, But whom say ye that I am?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter answered, and said, Thou art that Christ, the son of the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said to him, Blessed art thou, Simon, the son of Jonah: for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but my Father which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say also unto thee, that thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my Church: and the gates of hell shall not overcome it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give unto thee the keys of the Kingdom of heaven, and whatsoever thou shalt bind upon earth, shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth, shall be loosed in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he charged his disciples, that they should tell no man that he was Jesus that Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time forth Jesus began to show unto his disciples, that he must go unto Jerusalem, and suffer many things of the Elders, and of the high Priests, and Scribes, and be slain and be raised again the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter took him aside, and began to rebuke him, saying, Master, pity thyself: this shall not be unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he turned back, and said unto Peter, Get thee behind me, Satan: thou art an offence unto me, because thou understandest not the things that are of God, but the things that are of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus then said to his disciples, If any man will follow me, let him forsake himself: and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever will save his life, shall lose it: and whosoever shall lose his life for my sake, shall find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what shall it profit a man though he should win the whole world, if he lose his own soul? or what shall a man give for recompense of his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his Angels, and then shall he give to every man according to his deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the Son of man come in his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after six days, Jesus took Peter and James, and John his brother, and brought them up into an high mountain apart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the Sun, and his clothes were as white as the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there appeared unto them Moses, and Elijah, talking with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Peter, and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles, one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud shadowed them: and behold, there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is that my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased: hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples heard that, they fell on their faces, and were sore afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came and touched them, and said, Arise, and be not afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, Show the vision to no man, until the Son of man rise again from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the Scribes that Elijah must first come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto them, Certainly Elijah must first come, and restore all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you, that Elijah is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they would: likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples perceived that he spake unto them of John Baptist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a certain man, and fell down at his feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, Master, have pity on my son: for he is lunatic, and is sore vexed: for oft times he falleth into the fire, and oft times into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not heal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said, O generation faithless, and crooked, how long now shall I be with you! how long now shall I suffer you! bring him hither to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked the devil, and he went out of him: and the child was healed at that hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, if ye have faith as much as is a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place, and it shall remove: and nothing shall be impossible unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit this kind goeth not out, but by prayer and fasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they being in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The Son of Man shall be delivered into the hands of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall kill him, but the third day shall he rise again: and they were very sorry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received poll money, came to Peter, and said, Doth not your Master pay poll money?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon? Of whom do the kings of the earth take tribute, or poll money? of their children, or of strangers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said unto him, Of strangers. Then said Jesus unto him, Then are the children free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, lest we should offend them: go to the sea, and cast in an angle, and take the first fish that cometh up, and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of twenty pence: that take, and give it unto them for me and thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same time the disciples came unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, Verily I say unto you, except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall receive one such little child in my Name, receiveth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whosoever shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me, it were better for him, that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be unto the world because of offences, for it must needs be that offences shall come, but woe be to that man by whom the offence cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, if thy hand or thy foot cause thee to offend, cut them off, and cast them from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life, halt, or maimed, than having two hands, or two feet, to be cast into everlasting fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if thine eye cause thee to offend, pluck it out and cast it from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that ye despise not one of these little ones: for I say unto you, that in heaven their Angels always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How think ye? If a man have an hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave ninety and nine, and go into the mountains, and seek that which is gone astray?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth more of that sheep, than of the ninety and nine which went not astray:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So is it not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, if thy brother trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone: if he hear thee, thou hast won thy brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he hear thee not, take yet with thee one or two, that by the mouth of two or three witnesses, every word may be confirmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he refuse to hear them, tell it unto the Church: and if he refuse to hear the Church also, let him be unto thee as an heathen man, and a Publican.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Whatsoever ye bind on earth, shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye loose on earth, shall be loosed in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, verily I say unto you, that if two of you shall agree in earth upon anything, whatsoever they shall desire, it shall be given them of my Father which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where two or three are gathered together in my Name, there am I in the midst of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came Peter to him, and said, Master, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I shall forgive him? unto seven times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, I say not to thee, Unto seven times, but, Unto seventy times seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain King, which would take an account of his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which ought him ten thousand talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he had nothing to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and his children, and all that he had, and the debt to be paid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant therefore fell down, and worshipped him, saying, Lord, refrain thine anger toward me, and I will pay thee all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then that servant’s lord had compassion, and loosed him, and forgave him the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the servant was departed, he found one of his fellow servants which ought him an hundred pence, and he laid hands on him, and throttled him, saying, Pay me that thou owest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his fellow servant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Refrain thine anger toward me, and I will pay thee all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet he would not, but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his other fellow servants saw what was done, they were very sorry, and came, and declared unto their lord all that was done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his lord called him unto him, and said to him, O evil servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou prayedst me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oughtest not thou also to have had pity on thy fellow servant, even as I had pity on thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise shall mine heavenly Father do unto you, except ye forgive from your hearts, each one to his brother their trespasses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that when Jesus had finished these sayings, he departed from Galilee, and came into the coasts of Judea beyond Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great multitudes followed him, and he healed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came unto him the Pharisees tempting him, and saying to him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife upon every occasion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said unto them, Have ye not read, that he which made them at the beginning, made them male and female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, For this cause, shall a man leave father and mother, and cleave unto his wife, and they which were two, shall be one flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore they are no more twain, but one flesh. Let not man therefore put asunder that, which God hath coupled together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, Why did then Moses command to give a bill of divorcement, and to put her away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto them, Moses, because of the hardness of your heart, suffered you to put away your wives: but from the beginning it was not so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say therefore unto you, that whosoever shall put away his wife, except it be for whoredom, and marry another, commiteth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her which is divorced, doth commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said his disciples to him, If the matter be so between man and wife, it is not good to marry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, All men cannot receive this thing, save they to whom it is given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are some eunuchs, which were so born of their mother’s belly: and there be some eunuchs, which be gelded by men: and there be some eunuchs, which have gelded themselves for the kingdom of heaven. He that is able to receive this, let him receive it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then were brought unto him little children, that he should put his hands on them, and pray: and the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, Suffer little children, and forbid them not to come to me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had put his hands on them, he departed thence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one came and said unto him, Good Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Why called thou me good? there is none good but one, even God: but if thou wilt enter into life, keep the Commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto him, Which? And Jesus said, These, Thou shalt not kill: Thou shalt not commit adultery: Thou shalt not steal: Thou shalt not bear false witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor thy father, and mother: and, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man said unto him, I have observed all these things from my youth. What lack I yet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, If thou wilt be perfect, go, sell that thou hast, and give it to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful: for he had great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto his disciples, Verily I say unto you, that a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples heard it, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, Who then can be saved?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus beheld them, and said unto them, With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Peter, and said to him, Behold, we have forsaken all, and followed thee: what therefore shall we have?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Verily I say to you, that when the Son of man shall sit in the throne of his Majesty, ye which followed me in the regeneration, shall sit also upon twelve thrones, and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall forsake houses, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my Name’s sake, he shall receive an hundredfold more, and shall inherit everlasting life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many that are first, shall be last, and the last shall be first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain householder, which went out at the dawning of the day to hire laborers into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he agreed with the laborers for a penny a day, and sent them into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, Go ye also into my vineyard, and whatsoever is right, I will give you: and they went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went about the eleventh hour, and found others standing idle, and said unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said unto him, Because no man hath hired us. He said to them, Go ye also into my vineyard, and whatsoever is right, that shall ye receive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when even was come, the master of the vineyard said unto his steward, Call the laborers, and give them their hire, beginning at the last, till thou come to the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they which were hired about the eleventh hour, came and received every man a penny.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the first came, they supposed that they should receive more, but they likewise received every man a penny.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had received it, they murmured against the master of the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, These last have wrought but one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us, which have borne the burden and heat of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered one of them, saying, Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst thou not agree with me for a penny?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take that which is thine own, and go thy way: I will give unto this last, as much as to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not lawful for me to do as I will with mine own? Is thine eye evil, because I am good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the last shall be first, and the first last: for many are called, but few chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went up to Jerusalem, and took the twelve disciples apart in the way, and said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief Priests, and unto the Scribes, and they shall condemn him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall deliver him to the Gentiles, to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify him, but the third day he shall rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came to him the mother of Zebedee’s children with her sons, worshipping him, and desiring a certain thing of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto her, What wouldest thou? She said to him, Grant that these my two sons may sit, the one at thy right hand, and the other at thy left hand in thy kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I shall be baptized with? they said to him, We are able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Ye shall drink indeed of my cup, and shall be baptized with the baptism, that I am baptized with, but to sit at my right hand, and at my left hand, is not mine to give: but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared of my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the other ten heard this, they disdained at the two brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Jesus called them unto him, and said, Ye know that the lords of the Gentiles have domination over them, and they that are great, exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it shall not be so among you: but whosoever will be great among you, let him be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as the Son of man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life for the ransom of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, two blind men, sitting by the way side, when they heard that Jesus passed by, cried, saying, O Lord, the Son of David, have mercy on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude rebuked them, because they should hold their peace: but they cried the more, saying, O Lord, the Son of David, have mercy on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus stood still, and called them, and said, What will ye that I should do to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus moved with compassion, touched their eyes, and immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they drew near to Jerusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto the mount of the Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying to them, Go into the town that is over against you, and anon ye shall find an ass bound, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any man say ought unto you, say ye, that the Lord hath need of them, and straightway he will let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this was done that it might be fulfilled, which was spoken by the Prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell ye the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek and sitting upon an ass, and a colt, the foal of an ass used to the yoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples went, and did as Jesus had commanded them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And brought the ass and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and set him thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a great multitude spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches from the trees, and strawed them in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the people that went before, and they also that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the Son of David, Blessed be he that cometh in the Name of the Lord, Hosanna thou which art in the highest heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people said, This is Jesus that Prophet of Nazareth in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went into the Temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the Temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said to them, It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of thieves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the blind, and the halt came to him, in the Temple, and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the chief Priests and Scribes saw the marvels that he did, and the children crying in the Temple, and saying, Hosanna to the Son of David, they disdained,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus said unto them, Yea: read ye never, By the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast made perfect the praise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he left them, and went out of the city unto Bethany, and lodged there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning, as he returned into the city, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said to it, Never fruit grow on thee henceforward. And anon the fig tree withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, if ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do that, which I have done to the fig tree, but also if ye say unto this mountain, Take thyself away, and cast thyself into the sea, it shall be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, if ye believe, ye shall receive it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come into the Temple, the chief Priests, and the Elders of the people came unto him, as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto them, I also will ask of you a certain thing, which if ye tell me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven, or of men? Then they reasoned among themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven, he will say unto us, Why did ye not then believe him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if we say, Of men, we fear the multitude, for all hold John as a Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they answered Jesus, and said, We can not tell. And he said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what think ye? A certain man had two sons, and came to the elder, and said, Son, go and work today in my vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said, I will not: yet afterward he repented himself, and went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came he to the second, and said likewise. And he answered, and said, I will, Sir: yet he went not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether of them twain did the will of the father? They said unto him, The first. Jesus said unto them, Verily I say unto you, that the Publicans and the harlots go before you into the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the Publicans and the harlots believed him, and ye though ye saw it, were not moved with repentance afterward, that ye might believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear another parable, There was a certain householder, which planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and made a winepress therein, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a strange country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen to receive the fruits thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the husbandmen took his servants and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent other servants, more than the first: and they did the like unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But last of all he sent unto them his own son, saying, They will reverence my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, and let us take his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and slew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When therefore the Lord of the vineyard shall come, what will he do to those husbandmen?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said unto him, He will cruelly destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall deliver him the fruits in their seasons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Read ye never in the Scriptures, The stone which the builders refused, the same is made the head of the corner? This was the Lord’s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and shall be given to a nation, which shall bring forth the fruits thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone, he shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will dash him in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief Priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they seeking to lay hands on him, feared the people, because they took him as a Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and spake unto them again in parables, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king which married his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sent forth his servants, to call them that were bidden to the wedding, but they would not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent forth other servants, saying, Tell them which are bidden, Behold, I have prepared my dinner: mine oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready: come unto the marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his farm, and another about his merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the remnant took his servants, and entreated them sharply, and slew them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the king heard it, he was wroth, and sent forth his warriors, and destroyed those murderers, and burnt up their city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to his servants, Truly the wedding is prepared: but they which were bidden, were not worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go ye therefore out into the highways, and as many as ye find, bid them to the marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together all that ever they found, both good and bad: so the wedding was furnished with guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king came in, to see the guests, and saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither, and hast not on a wedding garment? And he was speechless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot: take him away, and cast him into utter darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many are called, but few chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then went the Pharisees and took counsel how they might tangle him in talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent unto him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God truly, neither carest for any man: for thou considerest not the person of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell us therefore, how thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, Why tempt ye me, ye hypocrites?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show me the tribute money. And they brought him a penny.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Whose is this image and superscription?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said unto him, Caesar’s. Then said he unto them, Give therefore to Caesar, the things which are Caesar’s, and give unto God, those things which are God’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard it, they marveled, and left him, and went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day the Sadducees came to him, (which say that there is no resurrection) and asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Master, Moses said, If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife by the right of alliance, and raise up seed unto his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore were with us seven brethren, and the first married a wife, and deceased: and having no issue, left his wife unto his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise also the second, and the third, unto the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And last of all the woman died also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore in the resurrection, whose wife shall she be of the seven? for all had her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto them, Ye are deceived, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry wives, nor wives are bestowed in marriage, but are as the Angels of God in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And concerning the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read what is spoken unto you of God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the multitude heard it, they were astonied at his doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees had heard, that he had put the Sadducees to silence, they assembled together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them, which was an expounder of the Law, asked him a question, tempting him, and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Master, which is the great commandment in the Law?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thine heart, with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the first and the great commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second is like unto this, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On these two commandments hangeth the whole Law and the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ¶While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, What think ye of Christ? whose son is he? They said unto him, David’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto them, How then doth David in spirit, call him Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then David call him Lord, how is he his son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And none could answer him a word, neither durst any from that day forth ask him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then spake Jesus to the multitude, and to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, The Scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe, that observe and do: but after their works do not: for they say, and do not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they bind heavy burdens, and grievous to be borne, and lay them on men’s shoulders, but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All their works they do for to be seen of men: for they make their phylacteries broad, and make long the fringes of their garments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And love the chief place at feasts, and to have the chief seats in the assemblies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And greetings in the markets, and to be called of men, Rabbi, Rabbi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be not ye called, Rabbi: for one is your doctor, to wit, Christ, and all ye are brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And call no man your father upon the earth: for there is but one, your father which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not called doctors: for one is your doctor, even Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that is greatest among you, let him be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever will exalt himself, shall be brought low: and whosoever will humble himself, shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe therefore be unto you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because ye shut up the kingdom of heaven before men: for ye yourselves go not in, neither suffer ye them that would enter, to come in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be unto you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites: for ye devour widows’ houses, even under a color of long prayers: wherefore ye shall receive the greater damnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be unto you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites: for ye compass sea and land to make one of your profession: and when he is made, ye make him twofold more the child of hell, than you yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be unto you blind guides, which say, Whosoever sweareth by the Temple, it is nothing: but whosoever sweareth by the gold of the Temple, he offendeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye fools and blind, Whether is greater, the gold, or the Temple that sanctifieth the gold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever sweareth by the altar, it is nothing: but whosoever sweareth by the offering that is upon it, offendeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye fools and blind, whether is greater, the offering, or the altar which sanctifieth the offering?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever therefore sweareth by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever sweareth by the Temple, sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that sweareth by heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth theron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites: for ye tithe mint, and anise, and cummin, and leave the weightier matters of the law, as judgment, and mercy and fidelity. These ought ye to have done, and not to have left the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye blind guides, which strain out a gnat, and swallow a camel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites: for ye make clean the utter side of the cup, and of the platter: but within they are full of bribery and excess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first the inside of the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites: for ye are like unto whited tombs, which appear beautiful outward, but are within full of dead men’s bones, and all filthiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So are ye also: for outward ye appear righteous unto men, but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be unto you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites: for ye build the tombs of the Prophets, and garnish the sepulchers of the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partners with them in the blood of the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then ye be witnesses unto yourselves, that ye are the children of them that murdered the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fulfill ye also the measure of your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O serpents, the generation of vipers, how should ye escape the damnation of hell!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore behold, I send unto you Prophets, and wise men, and Scribes, and of them ye shall kill and crucify: and of them shall ye scourge in your Synagogues, and persecute from city to city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood that was shed upon the earth, from the blood of Abel the righteous, unto the blood of Zechariah the son of Berechiah, whom ye slew between the Temple and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, all these things shall come upon this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the Prophets, and stonest them which are sent to thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, as the hen gathered her chickens under her wings, and ye would not!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your habitation shall be left unto you desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, ye shall not see me henceforth till that ye say, Blessed is he that cometh in the Name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went out, and departed from the Temple, and his disciples came to him, to show him the building of the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, See ye not all these things? Verily I say unto you, there shall not be here left a stone upon a stone, that shall not be cast down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives, his disciples came unto him apart, saying, Tell us when these things shall be, and what sign shall be of thy coming, and of the end of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto them, Take heed that no man deceive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many shall come in my Name, saying, I am Christ, and shall deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall hear of wars, and rumors of wars: see that ye be not troubled: for all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation shall rise against nation, and realm against realm, and there shall be famine, and pestilence, and earthquakes in divers places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these are but the beginning of sorrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted, and shall kill you, and ye shall be hated of all nations for my Name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then shall many be offended, and shall betray one another, and shall hate one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many false prophets shall arise, and shall deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because iniquity shall be increased, the love of many shall be cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that endureth to the end, he shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this Gospel of the kingdom shall be preached through the whole world for a witness unto all nations, and then shall the end come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation spoken of by Daniel the Prophet, set in the holy place (let him that readeth consider it.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let them which be in Judea, flee into the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him which is on the housetop, not come down to fetch anything out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that is in the field, let not him return back to fetch his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And woe shall be to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But pray that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not from the beginning of the world to this time, nor shall be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And except those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved: but for the elect’s sake those days shall be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here is Christ, or there, believe it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall show great signs and wonders, so that if it were possible, they should deceive the very elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have told you before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore if they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the desert, go not forth: Behold, he is in the secret places, believe it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the lightning cometh out of the East, and is seen into the West, so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For wheresoever a dead carcass is, thither will the Eagles be gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately after the tribulations of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven shall be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the kindreds of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man come in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall send his Angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect, from the four winds, and from the one end of the heavens unto the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now learn the parable of the fig tree: when her bough is yet tender, and it putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise ye, when ye see all these things, know that the kingdom of God is near, even at the doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, this generation shall not pass, till all these things be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of that day and hour knoweth no man, no not the Angels of heaven, but my father only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as the days of Noah were, so likewise shall the coming of the Son of man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in the days before the flood, they did eat and drink, marry, and give in marriage, unto the day that Noah entered into the Ark,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And knew nothing, till the flood came, and took them all away, so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then two shall be in the fields, the one shall be received, and the other shall be refused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women shall be grinding at the mill: the one shall be received, and the other shall be refused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your master will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of this be sure, that if the good man of the house knew at what watch the thief would come, he would surely watch, and not suffer his house to be dug through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be ye also ready: for in the hour that ye think not, will the Son of man come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who then is a faithful servant and wise, whom his master hath made ruler over his household, to give them meat in season?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant, whom his master when he cometh, shall find so doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, he shall make him ruler over all his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that evil servant shall say in his heart, My master doth defer his coming,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And begin to smite his fellows, and to eat, and to drink with the drunken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That servant’s master will come in a day, when he looketh not for him, and in an hour that he is not aware of,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And will cut him off, and give him his portion with hypocrites: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the kingdom of heaven shall be likened unto ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And five of them were wise, and five foolish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foolish took their lamps, but took no oil with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the bridegroom tarried long, all slumbered and slept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at midnight there was a cry made, Behold, the bridegroom cometh: go out to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the foolish said to the wise, Give us of your oil, for our lamps are out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wise answered, saying, Not so, lest there will not be enough for us and you: but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came: and they that were ready, went in with him to the wedding, and the gate was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterwards came also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch therefore: for ye know neither the day, nor the hour, when the son of man will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the kingdom of heaven is as a man that going into a strange country, called his servants, and delivered to them his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto one he gave five talents, and to another two, and to another one, to every man after his own ability, and straightway went from home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he that had received the five talents, went and occupied with them, and gained other five talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise also he that received two, he also gained other two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that received that one, went and dug it in the earth, and hid his master’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after a long season, the master of those servants came, and reckoned with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came he that had received five talents, and brought other five talents, saying, Master, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: behold, I have gained with them other five talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his master said unto him, It is well done good servant and faithful, Thou hast been faithful in little, I will make thee ruler over much: enter into thy master’s joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also he that had received two talents, came, and said, Master, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: behold, I have gained two other talents more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master said unto him, It is well done good servant, and faithful, Thou hast been faithful in little, I will make thee ruler over much: enter into thy master’s joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he that had received the one talent, came, and said, Master, I knew that thou wast an hard man, which reapest where thou sowedst not, and gatherest where thou strawedst not:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was therefore afraid, and went, and hid thy talent in the earth: behold, thou hast thine own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his master answered, and said unto him, Thou evil servant, and slothful, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I strawed not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers, and then at my coming should I have received mine own with vantage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him which hath ten talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto every man that hath, it shall be given, and he shall have abundance, and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast therefore that unprofitable servant into utter darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Son of man cometh in his glory and all the holy Angels with him, then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And before him shall be gathered all nations, and he shall separate them one from another as a shepherd separateth the sheep from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall set the sheep on his right hand, and the goats on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the king say to them on his right hand, Come ye blessed of my father: take the inheritance of the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was an hungered, and ye gave me meat: I thirsted, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungered, and fed thee? or athirst, and gave thee drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in unto us? or naked, and clothed thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king shall answer, and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall he say to them on the left hand, Depart from me ye cursed, into everlasting fire, which is prepared for the devil and his angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was an hungered, and ye gave me no meat: I thirsted, and ye gave me no drink:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in unto you: I was naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall they also answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungered, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall he answer them, and say, Verily I say unto you, inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these shall go into everlasting pain, and the righteous into life eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye know that after two days is the Passover, and the Son of man shall be delivered to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then assembled together the chief Priests, and the Scribes, and the Elders of the people into the hall of the high Priest called Caiaphas:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And consulted together that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, Not on the feast day, lest any uproar be among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There came unto him a woman, which had a box of very costly ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, What needed this waste?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and been given to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus knowing it, said unto them, Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye have the poor always with you, but me shall ye not have always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in that she poured this ointment on my body, she did it to bury me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, wheresoever this Gospel shall be preached throughout all the world, there shall also this that she hath done, be spoken of for a memorial of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief Priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, What will ye give me, and I will deliver him unto you, and they appointed unto him thirty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from that time, he sought opportunity to betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of the feast of unleavened bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the Passover?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Go ye into the city to such a man, and say to him, The master saith, My time is at hand: I will keep the Passover at thine house with my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples did as Jesus had given them charge, and made ready the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the even was come, he sat down with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they did eat, he said, Verily, I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him, Is it I, Master?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, He that dippeth his hand with me in the dish, he shall betray me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely the Son of man goeth his way, as it is written of him: but woe be to that man, by whom the Son of man is betrayed: it had been good for that man, if he had never been born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas which betrayed him, answered, and said, Is it I, master? He said unto him, Thou hast said it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they did eat, Jesus took the bread, and when he had blessed, he brake it, and gave it to the disciples, and said, Take, eat: this is my body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also he took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it them, saying, Drink ye all of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is my blood of the new Testament that is shed for many, for the remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you that I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine until that day, when I shall drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had sung a Psalm, they went out into the mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended by me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter answered, and said unto him, Though that all men should be offended by thee, yet will I never be offended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, that this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said unto him, Though I should die with thee, I will in no case deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then went Jesus with them into a place which is called Gethsemane, and said unto his disciples, Sit ye here, while I go, and pray yonder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took unto him Peter, and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to wax sorrowful, and grievously troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them, My soul is very heavy, even unto the death: tarry ye here, and watch with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went a little further, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me: nevertheless, not as I will, but as thou wilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After, he came unto the disciples, and found them asleep, and said to Peter, What? could ye not watch with me one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch, and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed is ready, but the flesh is weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went away the second time, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if this cup cannot pass away from me, but that I must drink it, thy will be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came he to his disciples, and said unto them, Sleep henceforth, and take your rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is given into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise, let us go: behold, he is at hand that betrayeth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he yet spake, lo, Judas one of the twelve came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the high Priests and Elders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he that betrayed him, had given them a token, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that is he, lay hold on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And forthwith he came to Jesus, and said, God save thee, Master, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, Friend, wherefore art thou come? Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one of them which were with Jesus, stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high Priest, and smote off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto him, Put up thy sword into his place: for all that take the sword, shall perish with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Either thinkest thou, that I cannot now pray to my Father, and he will give me more than twelve legions of Angels?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then should the Scriptures be fulfilled, which say, that it must be so?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same hour said Jesus to the multitude, Ye be come out as it were against a thief, with swords and staves to take me: I sat daily teaching in the Temple among you, and ye took me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all this was done, that the Scriptures of the Prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples forsook him, and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took Jesus, and led him to Caiaphas the high Priest, where the Scribes and the Elders were assembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter followed him afar off unto the high Priest’s hall, and went in and sat with the servants to see the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief Priests and the Elders, and all the whole Council sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they found none, and though many false witnesses came, yet found they none: but at the last came two false witnesses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, This man said, I can destroy the Temple of God, and build it in three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief Priest arose, and said to him, Answerest thou nothing? What is the matter that these men witness against thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus held his peace. Then the chief Priest answered, and said to him, I charge thee swear unto us by the living God, to tell us, If thou be that Christ the son of God, or no.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, Thou hast said it: nevertheless I say unto you, Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man, sitting at the right hand of the power of God, and come in the clouds of the heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high Priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath blasphemed, what have we any more need of witnesses: behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What think ye? They answered, and said, He is guilty of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then spat they in his face, and buffeted him, and others smote him with rods,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Prophesy to us, O Christ, Who is he that smote thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter sat without in the hall, and a maid came to him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied before them all, saying, I wot not what thou sayest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he went out into the porch, another maid saw him, and said unto them that were there, This man was also with Jesus of Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he denied with an oath, saying, I know not the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after a while, came unto him they that stood by, and said unto Peter, Surely thou art also one of them: for even thy speech bewrayeth thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then began he to curse himself, and to swear, saying, I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter remembered the words of Jesus, which had said unto him, Before the cock crow thou shalt deny me thrice. So he went out, and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the morning was come, all the chief Priests, and the Elders of the people took counsel against Jesus, to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And led him away bound, and delivered him unto Pontius Pilate the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Judas which betrayed him, saw that he was condemned, he repented himself, and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief Priests, and Elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, I have sinned, betraying the innocent blood. But they said, What is that to us? see thou to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had cast down the silver pieces in the Temple, he departed, and went, and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief Priests took the silver pieces, and said, It is not lawful for us to put them into the treasure, because it is the price of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took counsel, and bought with them a potter’s field, for the burial of strangers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore that field is called, The field of blood, until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the Prophet, saying, And they took thirty silver pieces, the price of him that was valued, whom they of the children of Israel valued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord appointed me.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou that King of the Jews? Jesus said unto him, Thou sayest it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was accused of the chief Priests, and Elders, he answered nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they lay against thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered him not to one word, insomuch that the governor marveled greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the feast the governor was wont to deliver unto the people a prisoner whom they would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had then a notable prisoner called Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were then gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whether will ye that I let loose unto you Barabbas, or Jesus which is called Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he knew well, that for envy they had delivered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also when he was set down upon the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that just man: for I have suffered many things this day in a dream by reason of him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief Priests and the elders had persuaded the people that they should ask Barabbas, and should destroy Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the governor answered, and said unto them, Whether of the twain will ye that I let loose unto you? And they said, Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said unto them, What shall I do then with Jesus, which is called Christ? They all said to him, Let him be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the governor, But what evil hath he done? Then they cried the more, saying, Let him be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate saw that he availed nothing, but that more tumult was made, he took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just man: look you to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered all the people, and said, His blood be on us, and on our children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus let he Barabbas loose unto them, and scourged Jesus, and delivered him to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered about him the whole band,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stripped him, and put about him a scarlet robe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And platted a crown of thorns, and put it upon his head, and a reed in his right hand, and bowed their knees before him, and mocked him, saying, God save thee, King of the Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And spitted upon him, and took a reed, and smote him on the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus when they had mocked him, they took the robe from him, and put his own raiment on him, and let him away to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, named Simon: him they compelled to bear his cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came unto the place called Golgotha (that is to say, the place of dead men’s skulls)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave him vinegar to drink, mingled with gall: and when he had tasted thereof, he would not drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, and did cast lots, that it might be fulfilled, which was spoken by the Prophet, They divided my garments among them, and upon my vesture did cast lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sat and watched him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set up also over his head his cause written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that passed by, reviled him, wagging their heads,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And saying, Thou that destroyest the Temple, and buildest it in three days, save thyself: if thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise also the high Priests mocking him, with the Scribes, and Elders, and Pharisees, said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saved others, but he cannot save himself: if he be the king of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He trusted in God, let him deliver him now, if he will have him: for he said, I am the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The self same thing also the thieves which were crucified with him, cast in his teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now from the sixth hour was there darkness over all the land, unto the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them that stood there, when they heard it, said, This man calleth Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway one of them ran, and took a sponge and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, Let be: let us see if Elijah will come and save him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus cried again with a loud voice, and yielded up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the veil of the Temple was rent in twain, from the top to the bottom, and the earth did quake, and the stones were cloven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the graves did open themselves, and many bodies of the Saints, which slept, arose,
verses.speaker: Narrator
