verses.text: And came out of the graves after his resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earth quake, and the things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many women were there, beholding him afar off, which had followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathea, named Joseph, who had also himself been Jesus’ disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to Pilate, and asked the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And put it in his new tomb, which he had hewn out in a rock, and rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulcher, and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulcher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the next day that followed the Preparation of the Sabbath, the high Priests and Pharisees assembled to Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, Within three days I will rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command therefore, that the sepulcher be made sure until the third day, lest his Disciples come by night, and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: so shall the last error be worse than the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said unto them, Ye have a watch: go, and make it sure, as ye know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went, and made the sepulcher sure, with the watch, and sealed the stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the end of the Sabbath, when the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, came to see the sepulcher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a great earthquake: for the Angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for fear of him, the keepers were astonied, and became as dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Angel answered, and said to the women, Fear ye not: for I know that ye seek Jesus which was crucified:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, for he is risen, as he said: come, see the place where the Lord was laid,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead: and behold, he goeth before you into Galilee: there ye shall see him: lo, I have told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they departed quickly from the sepulcher, with fear and great joy, and did run to bring his disciples word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus also met them, saying, God save you. And they came, and took him by the feet, and worshipped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them, Be not afraid. Go, and tell my brethren, that they go into Galilee, and there shall they see me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they were gone, behold, some of the watch came into the city, and showed unto the high Priests all the things that were done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gathered them together with the Elders, and took counsel, and gave large money unto the soldiers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Say, His disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if this matter come before the governor to be heard, we will persuade him, and so use the matter that you shall not need to care,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying is noised among the Jews unto this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the eleven disciples went into Galilee, into a mountain, where Jesus had appointed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus came, and spake unto them, saying, All power is given unto me, in heaven, and in earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the Name of the Father, and the Son, and the holy Ghost,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teaching them to observe all things, whatsoever I have commanded you: and lo, I am with you alway, until the end of the world, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
